body: A case the origin of which can be traced to a blood transfusion or other form of parenteral inoculation of the parasite (see Glossary for full definition) is not due to mosquito-borne transmission. It should be managed promptly. If there is a risk of ongoing transmission in the area, surveillance staff and the case household and neighbours should be alerted and asked to report any suspected malaria illness.
title: 2.6.3.4 Induced cases
